titleInfo.title: USA v. Brown
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 12/04/07 ORDERING that respondent USA is directed to file answer w/i 30 days to movant Brown's 96 MOTION to VACATE. Movant's traverse, if any, is due 30 days thereafter. Clerk to serve this order and movant's motion on the U.S. Attorney (cc: USA). (Benson, A)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 12/04/07 ORDERING that respondent USA is directed to file answer w/i 30 days to movant Brown's 96 MOTION to VACATE. Movant's traverse, if any, is due 30 days thereafter. Clerk to serve this order and movant's motion on the U.S. Attorney (cc: USA). (Benson, A)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Brown
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to Cy Irving Brown signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 3/10/08 ORDERING that respondent has set the 2/26/08, motion for a hearing on 3/19/08 on the court's calendar, any such hearing is VACATED. Movant has 30 days from the date of this order to file either an opposition or, within that same period, to stipulate to a waiver of attorney client privilege regarding specified areas and/or to the unsealing of certain sealed documents. If movant elects to oppose the motion, respondent will have 15 days to file a reply to any timely opposition, after which the motion will be deemed submitted. Respondent is GRANTED an additional extension of time of 60 days to file a response to the ยง 2255 motion. (Anderson, J)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER as to Cy Irving Brown signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 3/10/08 ORDERING that respondent has set the 2/26/08, motion for a hearing on 3/19/08 on the court's calendar, any such hearing is VACATED. Movant has 30 days from the date of this order to file either an opposition or, within that same period, to stipulate to a waiver of attorney client privilege regarding specified areas and/or to the unsealing of certain sealed documents. If movant elects to oppose the motion, respondent will have 15 days to file a reply to any timely opposition, after which the motion will be deemed submitted. Respondent is GRANTED an additional extension of time of 60 days to file a response to the ยง 2255 motion. (Anderson, J)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Brown
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 5/15/2008 ORDERING 103 The Clerk to unseal all portions of the transcripts of the 11/20/2003 and 12/9/2003 80 proceedings in this case; Attorneys Dawson and Balazs, within 20 days, to transmit to counsel for the US all documents related to their communications with Defendant Brown; Dawson and Balazs, within 20 days, to assist counsel for the US by submitting for interviews as reasonably requested by the US concerning their communications with Dft Brown and their work on this case. Respondent to be permitted a further extension of time of 45 days from the date of this order to file an answer. The Clerk of the Court to serve this order upon, in addition to the parties in this action, Attorneys Dawson and Balazs. (Reader, L)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Respondent to be permitted a further extension of time of 45 days from the date of this order to file an answer. The Clerk of the Court to serve this order upon, in addition to the parties in this action, Attorneys Dawson and Balazs. (Reader, L)

(Becknal, R)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Brown
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER and FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 04/05/10 ORDERING that no evidentiary hearing will be held. Also, RECOMMENDING that the motion 96 and the supplemeal motions 114, 115 be denied with the exception of Brown's ineffective assistance of Ameline remand counsel; due to the concession of the United States, Brown should be given a third sentencing hearing. Motions 96, 114, 115 referred to Judge Morrison C. England Jr. Objections due within 14 days. (Plummer, M)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER and FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Gregory G. Hollows on 04/05/10 ORDERING that no evidentiary hearing will be held. titleInfo.title: USA v. Brown
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER ADOPTING 125 FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS in full signed by Judge Morrison C. England, Jr. on 06/14/10 as to Cy Irving Brown and ORDERING that Brown's 96 Motion to Vacate - 2255 and supplemental 114, 115 Motions are DENIED with the exception of Brown's ineffective assistance of Ameline remand counsel; due to the concession of the U.S., Brown is to be given a third sentencing hearing. Clerk to close the companion civil case, No. CIV. S-07-2044. (Benson, A.)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Brown
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER signed by Chief Judge Morrison C. England, Jr. on 11/7/2013. Defendant Cy Irving Brown (xref # 2021639) is GRANTED pro se status as of this date. He shall be afforded all rights and privileges to which pro se litigants are entitled pursuant to applicable law and prison rules and regulations. Clerk directed to change defendant Brown's address listed on 152 Ex Parte Motion. Finally, government order to serve this Order on appropriate authorities at Sacramento County Main Jail. (Marciel, M)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER signed by Chief Judge Morrison C. England, Jr. on 11/7/2013. Defendant Cy Irving Brown (xref # 2021639) is GRANTED pro se status as of this date. He shall be afforded all rights and privileges to which pro se litigants are entitled pursuant to applicable law and prison rules and regulations. Clerk directed to change defendant Brown's address listed on 152 Ex Parte Motion. Finally, government order to serve this Order on appropriate authorities at Sacramento County Main Jail. (Marciel, M)
